New Records: Julian Alvarez scored a stunning goal from 20 yards out in the 84th minute, marking a significant individual achievement.
Alexis Mac Allister scored the opener and linked well with the striker tandem, showcasing his attacking influence.
Key Match Events: Julian Alvarez's goal in the 84th minute proved decisive for Argentina.
Paulo Dybala scored a third goal in stoppage time, sealing the victory late in the match.
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina paid an emotional tribute to Angel Di Maria, who retired from international football after the match.
The match was significant as Argentina aimed to overcome a Copa America hangover and started strongly after the halftime switch in strategy.
Post-Match Reflections: Lionel Scaloni praised his team's second-half performance and highlighted the impact of substitutes like Giovani Lo Celso and Paulo Dybala.
The victory kept Argentina atop the CONMEBOL standings with 18 points, solidifying their position in World Cup qualifying.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at a sold-out Estadio Monumental, with fans showing their support and creating an emotional atmosphere.
